intro: Gethyllis cuspidata, commonly known as the Cape mountain catchfly, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant has hairy stems and leaves, and its flowers are usually pink or white in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions. Gethyllis cuspidata is an important species for local biodiversity and is sometimes cultivated for its ornamental value.
